title: José Antonio Kast - Wikipedia
snippet: José Antonio Kast Rist (born 18 January 1966), also known by his initials JAK, is a Chilean lawyer and politician. He is the President-elect of Chile, after winning the 2025 Chilean general election.

title: Ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast elected Chile’s next president | Chile | The Guardian
snippet: During the campaign, he gave the roughly 330,000 undocumented migrants – most of them Venezuelan – an ultimatum to leave before the next president takes office on 11 March or be expelled “with only the clothes on their backs”.

title: Chile shifts sharply right as José Antonio Kast wins the presidency
snippet: A supporter of Chile's presidential candidate Jose Antonio Kast, of the Partido Republicano party. JAVIER TORRES/AFP via Getty Images hide caption toggle caption JAVIER TORRES/AFP via Getty Images · Kast is set to take office March 11, 2026.

title: Chile elects far-right José Antonio Kast as next president
snippet: Chile has elected the far-right wing José Antonio Kast to be its next president, after an election campaign that was dominated by themes of security, immigration and crime.

title: José Antonio Kast: Chile elects a Catholic, pro-life, and pro-family president – INFOVATICANA
snippet: In the presidential runoff of December 14, 2025, José Antonio Kast defeated left-wing candidate Jeannette Jara, becoming the president-elect of Chile. The result was confirmed after the official scrutiny and marks a significant shift in the ...
